properties.areaDesc: Marathon; Langlade; Lincoln; Forest; Wood; Oneida; Vilas
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 4:43PM CST by NWS Green Bay WI
properties.description:
An arctic cold front was dropping south across northern Wisconsin,
bringing a round of light snow. Most locations should see an inch
or two of snow before tapering off to scattered flurries later
this evening, except for snow showers continuing across Vilas
County. The combination of the falling snow, along with melting
snow from this afternoon and falling air temperatures well below
freezing could lead to a flash freeze this evening. Gusty northerly
winds may also create some areas of blowing and drifting snow.

Overnight, temperatures are expected to fall into the single
digits below zero. The combination of the cold temperatures and
gusty northerly winds will produce wind chill readings in the
15 below to 25 below zero range late tonight into Thursday
morning. Wind chill readings this low can produce frost bite
within 30 minutes.

Allow extra travel time if you will be driving this evening as
roads will be slippery due to ice and snow. If venturing outdoors,
wear layers of clothing along with a hat and gloves to protect
yourself from the bitter cold.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS EXPECTED THIS EVENING FOLLOWED BY BITTER COLD WIND CHILLS OVERNIGHT
